thread.title: Volcano and Ash Clouds Alert - November 20, 2025
thread.title_full: Volcano and Ash Clouds Alert - November 20, 2025

author: U.S. Mission Japan
title: Volcano and Ash Clouds Alert - November 20, 2025
text:
U.S. Citizen Services
Volcano and Ash Clouds Alert
Location: Sakurajima (Aira Caldera), Kagoshima City, and surrounding prefectures including Kumamoto and Miyazaki, Japan.
Event: The Sakurajima volcano has shown a significant increase in explosive activity since November 16, 2025, with a large eruption sending an ash plume up to 4,400 meters (approx. 14,400 feet).
- The Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA) maintains the Volcanic Alert Level at 3(out of 5), which signifies a Restriction on Proximity to the Volcano (Do Not Approach the Volcano).
- The primary danger near the crater is the ejection of large cinder blocks (volcanic rocks), which were observed falling as far as 1.2 kilometers away.
Restricted Area: Entry is strictly prohibited within a 2-kilometer radius of the Minamidake crater.
Actions to Take:
- Do not enter the restricted 2 km radiusaround the Minamidake crater. Respect all warnings and barricades posted by local authorities.
- Be Prepared for Ashfall:Residents and travelers in Kagoshima, Kumamoto, and Miyazaki prefectures should be aware of possible ashfall.
- Wear a mask or coveringover your mouth and nose if you are outdoors during ashfall to minimize respiratory irritation.
- Wear protective eyewear(goggles or glasses) to shield your eyes.
- Drive slowlyas volcanic ash can make roads slick and reduce visibility.
- Stay indoorswith windows and doors closed if heavy ashfall occurs.
- Check Travel Plans:Volcanic ash can disrupt air travel. Check with your airline for the latest flight status, especially if traveling to or from Kagoshima Airport (KOJ).
- Monitor Official Sources:Follow updates from the Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA) and local Kagoshima Prefecture authorities.
Local Resources:
- Emergency Services (Japan):Police: 110 | Fire/Ambulance: 119
- Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA) Volcanic Warnings (English):
https://www.data.jma.go.jp/multi/volcano/index.html?lang=en- S. Consulate Fukuoka (Jurisdiction includes Kagoshima):
- Routine Inquiries:81-92-751-9331 (Within Japan: 092-751-9331)
Assistance:
Follow us on Twitter and Facebook.
For information about services to U.S. citizens, please consult American Citizens Services (ACS).
For emergencies, contact the U.S. Embassy or nearest consulate.
- U.S. Embassy Tokyo
Telephone: 03-3224-5000 - U.S. Consulate General Osaka-Kobe
